marytts.modules
Class InternalModule

java.lang.Object
  marytts.modules.InternalModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
MaryModule
Direct Known Subclasses:
AcousticModeller, APMLParser, CARTDurationModeller, CARTF0Modeller, ContourGenerator, DummyAllophones2AcoustParams, DummyDuration2AcoustParams, DummyTokens2Words, FreeTTS2FestivalUtt, FreeTTSContourGenerator, FreeTTSIntonator, FreeTTSMbroliser, FreeTTSPartOfSpeechTagger, FreeTTSPauseGenerator, FreeTTSPhraser, FreeTTSSegmenter, FreeTTSTextToTokens, FreeTTSTokenToWords, HMMDurationF0Modeller, HTSEngine, InformationStructure, JPhonemiser, JPhonemiser, JTokeniser, KlattDurationModeller, KlattDurationModeller, MaryXMLToMbrola, MaryXMLToText, MinimalisticPosTagger, OpenNLPPosTagger, Phonemiser, Phonemiser, PolynomialF0Modeller, PraatTextGridGenerator, Preprocess, PronunciationModel, ProsodyGeneric, RealisedAcoustparamsExtractor, RealisedDurationsExtractor, SableParser, SimplePhoneme2AP, SoPDurationModeller, SoPF0Modeller, SSMLParser, Synthesis, SynthesisCallerBase, TargetFeatureLister, TextToMaryXML, TobiContourGenerator, Tokeniser, ToneBuilder, Utt2XMLBase, XML2UttBase
public class InternalModule
extends java.lang.Object
implements MaryModule

A stub implementation of the MaryModule interface as a basis for internal modules.

Any internal module extending this class will need to implement a constructor calling this class's constructor, and override process() in a meaningful way. Care must be taken to make sure the process() method is thread-seafe.

Example for a subclass: 

 public class Postlex extends InternalModule
 {
    public Postlex()
    {
        super("Postlex",
              MaryDataType.PHONEMISED,
              MaryDataType.POSTPROCESSED);
    }

    public MaryData process(MaryData d)
    throws Exception
    {
        Document doc = d.getDocument();
        mtuPostlex(doc);
        phonologicalRules(doc);
        MaryData result = new MaryData(outputType());
        result.setDocument(doc);
        return result;
    }

    private void mtuPostlex(Document doc) {...}
    private void phonologicalRules(Document doc) {...}
 }

Author:
Marc Schröder

process

public MaryData process(MaryData d)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Perform this module's processing on abstract "MaryData" input d. Subclasses need to make sure that the process() method is thread-safe, because in server-mode, it will be called from different threads at the same time. A sensible way to do this seems to be not to use any global or static variables, or to use them read-only.

Specified by:
process in interface MaryModule
Returns:
A MaryData object of type outputType() encapsulating the processing result.

This method just returns its input. Subclasses should override this.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
